thread.title: United Airlines expanding streaming entertainment to regional flights
thread.title_full: United Airlines expanding streaming entertainment to regional flights

author: Lewis Lazare
title: United Airlines expanding streaming entertainment to regional flights
text:
United Airlines expanding streaming entertainment to regional flights Aug 14, 2015, 10:58am CDT Industries & Tags Wayne Slezak United Airlines is pushing streaming entertainment on to its regional flight operations. United Airlines is expanding its free onboard streaming entertainment programming on to United Express regional flights with a two-cabin (first and economy) configuration. Passengers may check before departure whether streaming entertainment is available on their particular flights at united.com or via the United mobile app. Dubbed "United Private Screening, the free programming to view on passengers' personal devices already is available on some 200 United aircraft. The entertainment available includes first-run films, popular television shows, HBO and curated content from Vevo, a music video and entertainment platform â€” all viewable on travelers' laptop computers and iOS and Android mobile devices. Scott Wilson , United's vice president of merchandising and eCommerce, said of the expansion of the entertainment service: "We're designing United Private Screening to ensure our customers have access to content that is entertaining, interesting, wide-ranging and relaxing." Separately, United (NYSE: UAL) has launched a test tablets-for-rent program on widebody Boeing 777 flights between the continental United States and Honolulu and between Honolulu and Guam. The 8.4-inch tablets contain stored entertainment, including television shows, movies and games. 
Want Chicago Travel   Industries
